pkgmetadata.longdescription: ppgplot is a python module (extension) providing bindings to the PGPLOT graphics library. PGPLOT is a scientific visualization (graphics) library written in Fortran by T. J. Pearson. C bindings for PGPLOT are also available. ppgplot makes the library usable by Python programs. It uses the numeric / numarray modules (nowadays replaced by Numpy), to efficiently represent and manipulate vectors and matrices.
